newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares jump 2.4 pct to new record.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares jump 2.4 pct to new record.

text.p: The market index at Istanbul's stock exchange leapt 2.43 percent in selective activity to a new record on Thursday in positive mood after a censure motion against the government was rejected on Wednesday, brokers said.
The IMKB-100 rose 1,889.56 points from Wednesday to close at an all-time high of 79,719.25, compared to a previous high of 79,511.82 last Wednesday.
Trade volume soared to 24.2 trillion lira ($255 million) from Wednesday's 16.4 trillion ($173 million) with the help of limited cash entry, brokers said.

"The market showed a tendency to ease in the second session. But such fluctuations will continue tomorrow and early next week as the market targets the 80,000 level with share-based buying," said Haldun Sertel from Can securities.
Selective demand was based mainly on nine-month profit expectations.
Brokers said easier Treasury-bill yields and statements that the Treasury would not borrow from domestic markets until November could divert some more cash to the bourse.
The index had lost 2 2 percent in a week-long correction to Wednesday after surging 22.7 percent from September 13 to last Wednesday's sixth consequtive record close of 79,511.82.
